docs.text:
Penkridge Codeclub


Penkridge Codeclub is a registered with 
Codeclub UK
 and currently runs as an afterschool club at Marshbrook first school. The club promotes the learning of STEM subjects.


STEM stands for Science, Technology, Engineering and Maths.






Learn




Hour of code


Tinkercad








Volunteer




STEMNET


Codeclub

docs.text:
Hour of code


The hour of code is a hub for numerous coding games and projects. The choice of tutorials is hugely varied and there are options available for all ages, abilities and programming languages.


Get started here: 
https://code.org/learn
docs.title: Hour of code

docs.text:
Tinkercad


Tinkercad is a computer program used to create 3D models for computer games or printing.


Learn


The following tutorials will help you learn how to use Tinkercad.




Open Tinkercad and login




Beginner tutorials




Create a house


Create a car (coming soon)


Create a minion (coming soon)




How-to




Add shapes to my design


Resize shapes

docs.text:
Create a house


In this tutorial you will use simple shapes to create a 3D house.


1. Login


Open Tinkercad and login

docs.text: Open Tinkercad and login
docs.title: 1. Login

docs.text:
Adding shapes


A variety of shapes can be added to  your design




Find the required shape in the 
Basic shapes
 menu.


Drag the shape from the menu to the workplane.
docs.title: Add shapes

docs.text: A variety of shapes can be added to  your design   Find the required shape in the  Basic shapes  menu.  Drag the shape from the menu to the workplane.
docs.title: Adding shapes

docs.text:
Resizing shapes


Shapes can be resized in three ways:


Resizing with shape menu




Select an object; the shape menu will appear.


Select the dimension you want to edit.


Enter the required value and hit the [Enter] key.


The shape will change size on screen.






Resizing wth shape handles




Select an object; the handles will appear.


Select a handle beside a side or point with the dimension you want to change.


Select a dimension to change.


Enter the required value and hit the [Enter] key.


The shape will change size on screen.






Resizing by dragging




Select an object; the handles will appear.


Select a handle beside a side or point with the dimension you want to change.


Select a dimension to change.


Enter the required value and hit the [Enter] key.


The shape will change size on screen.
docs.title: Resize shapes

docs.text:
Volunteer


Our code club, and indeed all code clubs always need volunteers. 


So, if you want to help please step up :-)
docs.title: Volunteer
